nodes.bodyText: Original error message was more accurate

Yes, the original was a wrapping one, that goes to the same bucket as: #5379 (comment)
Should I extract that change to separate commit?
Naa - if that is the way to go I do not care about extracting as separate commit.

i raised similar problem over here #3109 (comment).
I am not convinced by the linked comment.
Especially for case SHOW STATS FOR table_name it seems a bit weird to throw "Cannot select from columns ...".

This is like CALL create_empty_partitions(...) that throws "Cannot insert into...".
It is not about being not allowed to call CALL create_empty_partitions() or SHOW STATS FOR x but not being able to create new partition (and so doing an insert) or not being able to see table data (and so doing a select). So this is more detailed. Also it is more actionable, as now you know that you need to GRANT INSERT or GRANT SELECT, while there is no GRANT CALL or GRANT SHOW STATS.
Surely this is one way of thinking. I was thinking differently here: #5379 (comment). Since after few iterations #5379 changed, I decided to change this pull request into the same direction to be coherent.
columnSizeForFormat is left unused

-                        .row("col", columnSizeForFormat(96.0), null, 0.0, null, "-10.0", "100.0")

nodes.bodyText: It's weird that Analyzer needs a stats calculator. In any case, why not provide a NOOP here?

nodes.bodyText:
rnn
more importantly though -- it's counter intuitive why Analyzer needs stats calculator. It seems analysis result doesn't depend on stats (the plan does). I see this is needed to pass to ShowStatsRewrite. Maybe we can inject it there at creation?

Analyzer is created on demand, most of it dependencies are session bound. Only statsCalculator is bound in guice. I can do what you suggest, but then I would need to pass StatementRewrite as parameter of Analyzer constructor. I can also extract AnalyzerFactory. Both options sounds to me like an overkill. WDYT?
right. nvrm

getRelation creates artificial query (simpleQuery(selectList(new AllColumns()), node.getRelation())), which we here analyze and plan. This can lead to eg AccessDeniedException referencing ... things user did not write. Previously we would post-process this with rewriteAccessDeniedException. Why is this not needed anymore?
@findepi Please see #3109 (comment)

Thanks, let's talk about messages in #3109 (comment)
even if message is perfect, we should make sure we don't let some artificial node location to go through. But perhaps you do not create any artificial node locations, so this isn't a problem?

artificial node location

Artificial nodes do not get any location, so it should not be a problem.
Why there is a change here?

there are also some meaningful changes:

null -> 0

nodes.bodyText:
I am going to extract redundant changes to separate commit.
Meaningful changes are after stats normalization, when there is no rows, then we also know how much nulls, ndv or data size is there.

nodes.bodyText:
You changed semantics here.
It used to be array of doubles, now it's array of decimal(2,1)
Same in some other places.
Can we drop this commit in order to expedite the merge of the important part of this PR?
I dropped this commit. Thanks

Please add a comment to the cmt message than now null fraction is normalized to 1 for tables with row count 0, regardless of what the stats returned by the connector.
Same for data size being normalized to 0 for all-null columns (regardless of table row count).
This may help in the future, when someone questions why the expected values changed in this commit.

nodes.bodyText:
Maybe add
// The two regionkey columns come from two different tables
Maybe add more than 1, so that the effect on min/max is more apparent.

Also, give expression an alias, so that you we do not have to update the tests when implicit column alias changes from _col0 to something else.
There needs to be a test with implicit column names, but let's have one dedicated test case for that.
(same in other places)

We should know the row count since it's NDV(orderkey), which is known.
Is it unknown because of partial aggregations?
Please file an issue to further improve this.

Add a test with
SELECT DISTINCT regionkey FROM nation

since NDV(regionkey) is known, the row count should be known.
I think it won't work yet (the same way as the GROUP BY case above), so
this will be a todo

row count should be 1, since this is a global agg
this may be useful for "helper" tables used with max to pull some information used in oiher places in a query
please add a todo

How do you know this filter has not been pushed down?
Please capture explanation for the filters used here in a code comment
Actually, I do not care how big part of predicate was pushed down. I will rename the test to testShowStatsWithPredicate
Push -> Pushed

This should be more contextual.
null makes sense

for min being -inf
for max being +inf
for row count, NDV, null fraction, data size being nan

but we probably should not output dull null eg when

row count is +inf

please maybe add a todo note?
same in toStringLiteral(Type type, double value) above

It is not used for min and max. I don't see a big difference between NaN and null from user perspective.

same in toStringLiteral(Type type, double value) above

toStringLiteral is used only for min and max where -inf and +inf is represented differently for different types.

please maybe add a todo note?

I don't fully understand you here, so let me skip that.

I don't see a big difference between NaN and null from user perspective.

I do not see either. There can be a difference between +inf and null.

It would improve readability if you extracted this to   method
String statsRow(String columnName, double datasize,....) 

also,

cast(1 AS double) can be expressed shortly with 1e0
uppercase CAST and NULL
I simplified it differently. Case fixed.

Nice.
please mention this normalization in a commit message as well
CAST(1 AS double) -> 1e0

CAST(1 AS double)
i still think a statsRow formatting function could be useful, but it looks good enough

                 USER,

-                .hasMessageMatching("\\QSHOW STATS for table with column masking is not supported: orderkey");

+                        "(NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 15e3, NULL, NULL)");

+                .matches("VALUES " +
